whatDoesThisSiteDo.title: What Does This Site Do?
whatDoesThisSiteDo.description: NoSleep is a web-based tool that prevents your computer or mobile device from going to sleep. Features include customizable auto-sleep timers, animated visual feedback, and browser compatibility with video fallback methods. Keep your device active during long processes without changing system settings or installing software.

useCases.question: What are the use cases?
answers: Timed tasks: Set 30-60 min timers for downloads/uploads
Long processes: 2-4 hour timers for video rendering
Development: 15-30 min timers for code compilation
Vibe coding: Extended coding sessions with AI assistants like Claude Code
Presentations: Keep screen active without interruption
Study sessions: Focus timers without device sleep

howItWorks.question: How does it work?
howItWorks.answer: This website uses the modern Screen Wake Lock API built into your browser. For unsupported browsers, it provides a video-based fallback method that requires user interaction to activate. The auto-sleep timer lets you set custom durations (1-480 minutes) for automatic wake lock release. Visual animations indicate when your device is being kept awake.

safety.question: Is it safe to use?
safety.answer: Yes, completely safe! This tool only uses standard web APIs and doesn't access your files, camera, microphone, or any personal data. It simply prevents your device from sleeping - the same as moving your mouse occasionally. No data is collected or transmitted.

browserSupport.question: Which browsers support this?
browserSupport.note: The app detects your browser capabilities and provides fallback options when native wake lock is unavailable.

timerFeature.question: How does the timer feature work?
timerFeature.answer: Click the "Timer" option to set a custom duration (1-480 minutes) for automatic sleep. Use the number input or quick increment buttons (+1, +5, +10, +30 minutes) to set your time. The device will automatically allow sleep when the timer expires, perfect for timed tasks like downloads, renders, or study sessions. You can cancel the timer anytime.

browserSupport.answer: Native Wake Lock API support includes Chrome 84+, Edge 84+, Safari 16.4+, and Firefox with polyfill. For broader compatibility, the app provides a video-based fallback method that works on browsers without native support.
